thread.title: Colleges Bend the Rules for More Students, Give Them Extra Help

author: Douglas Belkin
title: Colleges Bend the Rules for More Students, Give Them Extra Help
text:
As many as one in four students at some elite U.S. colleges are now classified as disabled, largely because of mental-health issues such as depression or anxiety, entitling them to a widening array of special accommodations like longer time to take exams.
Under federal law, students can be considered disabled if they have a note from a doctor. That label requires schools to offer accommodations depending on the studentâ€™s needs. A blind student, for example, would have access to specialized software or a reader for an exam.
